title: Ticket #6706: cmd_drain_scavenging intermittent failures
description:
Initial analysis indicates that that cmd_drain_scavenging is failing intermittently on Windows because we send WM_CLOSE when we would send SIGTERM on Linux, and perl doesn't (and can't?) convert that to SIGTERM internally, meaning that the job actually exits when requested, and HTCondor never transitions to preempting/killing, which is something the test is checking for.

TJ can provide a (tiny) 'sleepw.exe' binary that is a sleep command with a window, and have it ignore WM_CLOSE messages. This should enable us to actually test MAX_VACATE_TIME after draining on Windows, but may require nontrivial rewrites of the test, whose perl script sleeps but can be interrupted via a file.
